practice_cycles.short_explanation_for_cycle: This phase is necessary because establishing a rock-solid understanding of C# syntax and the principles of object-oriented programming ensures your future backend logic is maintainable and scalable. Without these core building blocks, your attempt to navigate the complex layers of the .NET ecosystem will likely lead to technical debt and deep frustration during later, more difficult modules.

primary_activity: Solving algorithmic problems using C# classes and interfaces
Building small-scale console applications for data processing
secondary_activity: Reading official documentation on C# memory management
Refactoring procedural code into object-oriented structures

difficulty_profile.comfortable: Basic loops, conditional logic, and simple property getters/setters.
difficulty_profile.challenging: Implementing generic constraints and handling asynchronous Task-based operations.

objective: Completion of 15 logic challenges without syntax errors
Zero compiler warnings on the final console project
subjective: Feeling confident when choosing between inheritance and composition
Intuitive understanding of when to use async/await

practice_cycles.focus_summary: Web API Architecture and Data Access
practice_cycles.short_explanation_for_cycle: This phase is necessary because modern backend development revolves around the communication between services via HTTP, and your ability to construct robust APIs is the primary way your applications will interact with the world. Mastering the routing, middleware, and dependency injection patterns within ASP.NET Core allows your systems to be flexible, testable, and compliant with industry standards.

primary_activity: Developing RESTful endpoints with ASP.NET Core controllers
Modeling database schemas using Entity Framework Core
secondary_activity: Writing unit tests for individual controller actions

difficulty_profile.comfortable: Setting up standard GET and POST endpoints with JSON returns.
difficulty_profile.challenging: Managing complex database relationships and implementing global exception handling middleware.

objective: Fully functional CRUD API successfully interacting with a local database
Test coverage of at least 60% for business logic
subjective: Clarity in how data flows from the client to the database
Confidence in resolving Entity Framework migration conflicts

objective: Code complexity scores in static analysis tools
API response latency in local benchmarks
Number of successful unit tests passed
subjective: Level of comfort reading advanced .NET source code
Satisfaction with the cleanliness of implemented patterns

architect_notes: Avoid the 'tutorial hell' by spending at least 60% of your time writing original code.
The jump from C# basics to ASP.NET Core is steep; use the official Microsoft documentation as your primary source.
Focus on understanding Dependency Injection early as it is the backbone of the .NET ecosystem.
With 10 hours a week, prioritize depth in one framework feature over breadth in many.

details.reason: User initiated a new learning session.

timeline.title: Initial Practice Strategy Created
timeline.summary: Initial practice strategy created for ['Learn C# .NET for backend development'].

details.reason: Sufficient information provided to create initial practice system.

constraints.dropout_risk: High complexity of framework architecture relative to weekly time
